010package imagingbook.pub.edgepreservingfilters.OLD;
011
012import ij.IJ;
013import ij.ImagePlus;
014import ij.plugin.filter.Convolver;
015import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
016import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
017import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
018
019// TODO: convert to subclass of GenericFilter using ImageAccessor (see BilateralFilter)
020
021/**
022 * This class implements the Anisotropic Diffusion filter proposed by David Tschumperle 
023 * in D. Tschumperle and R. Deriche, "Diffusion PDEs on vector-valued images", 
024 * IEEE Signal Processing Magazine, vol. 19, no. 5, pp. 16-25 (Sep. 2002). It is based 
025 * on an earlier C++ (CImg) implementation (pde_TschumperleDeriche2d.cpp) by the original
026 * author, made available under the CeCILL v2.0 license 
027 * (http://www.cecill.info/licences/Licence_CeCILL_V2-en.html).
028 * 
029 * This class is based on the ImageJ API and intended to be used in ImageJ plugins.
030 * How to use: consult the source code of the related ImageJ plugins for examples.
031 * 
032 * @author W. Burger
033 * @version 2013/05/30
034 */
035
036public class TschumperleDericheFilter_OLD {
037        
038        public static class Parameters {
039                /** Number of smoothing iterations */
040                public int iterations = 20;     
041                /** Adapting time step */
042                public double dt = 20.0;                
043                /** Gradient smoothing (sigma of Gaussian) */
044                public double sigmaG  = 0.5;    
045                /** Structure tensor smoothing (sigma of Gaussian) */
046                public double sigmaS  = 0.5;    
047                /** Diff. limiter along minimal var. (small value = strong smoothing) */
048                public float a1 = 0.25f;                
049                /** Diff. limiter along maximal var. (small value = strong smoothing) */
050                public float a2 = 0.90f;
051                /** Set true to apply the filter in linear RGB (assumes sRGB input) */
052                public boolean useLinearRgb = false;
053        }
054        
055        private final Parameters params;
056        private final int T;                    // number of iterations
057        
058        private int M;  // image width
059        private int N;  // image height
060        private int K;  // number of color channels, k = 0,...,K-1
061
062        private float[][][] I;          // float image data:            I[k][u][v] for color channel k
063        private float[][][] Dx;         // image x-gradient:            Dx[k][u][v] for color channel k
064        private float[][][] Dy;         // image y-gradient:            Dx[k][u][v] for color channel k
065        private float[][][] G;          // 2x2 structure tensor:        G[i][u][v], i=0,1,2 (only 3 elements because of symmetry)
066        private float[][][] A;          // 2x2 tensor field:            A[i][u][v], i=0,1,2 (only 3 elements because of symmetry)
067        private float[][][] B;          // scalar local velocity:   B[k][u][v]  for channel k (== beta_k)
068//      private float[][][] Hk;         // Hessian matrix for channel k: Hk[i][u][v], i=0,1,2
069        FloatProcessor tmpFp;           // used as temporary storage for blurring
070        
071        private float initial_max;
072        private float initial_min;
073        
074        // constructor - uses only default settings:
075        public TschumperleDericheFilter_OLD() {
076                this(new Parameters());
077        }
078        
079        // constructor - use for setting individual parameters:
080        public TschumperleDericheFilter_OLD(Parameters params) {
081                this.params = params;
082                T = params.iterations;
083        }
084        
085        /* This method applies the filter to the given image (ip). 
086         * Note that ip is destructively modified.
087         */
088        public void applyTo(ImageProcessor ip) {        
089                initialize(ip);
090                // main iteration loop
091                for (int pass = 1; pass <= T; pass++) {
092                        IJ.showProgress(pass, T);
093                        
094                        // Step 1:
095                        calculateGradients(I, Dx, Dy);
096                        
097                        // Step 2:
098                        smoothGradients(Dx, Dy);
099                        
100                        // Step 3: Hessian matrix is only calculated locally as part of Step 8.
101                        
102//                      if (pass == 1) {
103//                              new ImagePlus("Dx-0", new FloatProcessor(Dx[0])).show();
104//                              new ImagePlus("Dx-1", new FloatProcessor(Dx[1])).show();
105//                              new ImagePlus("Dx-2", new FloatProcessor(Dx[2])).show();
106//                              new ImagePlus("Dy-0", new FloatProcessor(Dy[0])).show();
107//                              new ImagePlus("Dy-1", new FloatProcessor(Dy[1])).show();
108//                              new ImagePlus("Dy-2", new FloatProcessor(Dy[2])).show();
109//                      }
110                        
111                        // Step 4:
112                        calculateStructureMatrix(Dx, Dy, G);
113                        
114//                      if (pass == 1) {
115//                              new ImagePlus("G-0", new FloatProcessor(G[0])).show();
116//                              new ImagePlus("G-1", new FloatProcessor(G[1])).show();
117//                              new ImagePlus("G-2", new FloatProcessor(G[2])).show();
118//                      }
119                        
120                        // Step 5:
121                        smoothStructureMatrix(G);
122
123                        // Step 6-7:
124                        calculateGeometryMatrix(G, A);
125                        
126                        // Step 8:
127                        float maxVelocity = calculateVelocities(I, A, B);
128                        
129                        double alpha = params.dt / maxVelocity;
130                        IJ.log("OLD: alpha = " + alpha);
131                        updateImage(I, B, alpha);
132                        IJ.log("done with iteratation " + pass);
133                }
134                copyResultToImage(ip);
135                cleanUp();
136        } 
137        
138        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
139        
140        /*
141         * Create temporary arrays, copy image data and calculate
142         * initial image statistics (all in one pass).
143         */
144        private void initialize(ImageProcessor ip) {
145                M = ip.getWidth(); 
146                N = ip.getHeight(); 
147                K = (ip instanceof ColorProcessor) ? 3 : 1;
148                I  = new float[K][M][N];
149                Dx  = new float[K][M][N];
150                Dy  = new float[K][M][N];
151                G = new float[3][M][N];
152                A = new float[3][M][N];
153                B = new float[K][M][N];
154//              Hk = new float[3][M][N];
155
156                if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor) {
157                        final int[] pixel = new int[K]; 
158                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
159                                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
160                                        ip.getPixel(u, v, pixel);
161                                        for (int k = 0; k < K; k++) {
162                                                float c = pixel[k];
163                                                I[k][u][v] = params.useLinearRgb ? srgbToRgb(c) : c;
164                                        }
165                                }
166                        }
167                }
168                else {  // 8-bit, 16-bit or 32-bit (float) processor
169                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
170                                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
171                                        I[0][u][v] = ip.getf(u,v);
172                                }
173                        }
174                }
175                getImageMinMax();
176        }
177        
178        void getImageMinMax() {
179                float max = Float.MIN_VALUE;
180                float min = Float.MAX_VALUE;
181                for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
182                        for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
183                                for (int k = 0; k < K; k++) {
184                                        float p = I[k][u][v];
185                                        if (p>max) max = p;
186                                        if (p<min) min = p;
187                                }
188                        }
189                }
190                initial_max = max;
191                initial_min = min;
192        }
193        
194        void cleanUp() {
195                I  = null;              Dx = null;              Dy = null;
196                G = null;               A = null;               B = null;
197//              Hk = null;              
198                tmpFp = null;
199        }
200        
201        void calculateGradients(float[][][] I, float[][][] Dx, float[][][] Dy) {
202                // these Gradient kernels produce reduced artifacts
203                final float c1 = (float) (2 - Math.sqrt(2.0)) / 4;
204                final float c2 = (float) (Math.sqrt(2.0) - 1) / 2;
205                
206                final float[][] Hdx = 
207                        {{-c1, 0, c1},
208                         {-c2, 0, c2},
209                         {-c1, 0, c1}};
210                
211                final float[][] Hdy = 
212                        {{-c1, -c2, -c1},
213                         {  0,   0,   0},
214                         { c1,  c2,  c1}};
215
216                for (int k = 0; k < K; k++) {
217                        convolve2dArray(I[k], Dx[k], Hdx);
218                        convolve2dArray(I[k], Dy[k], Hdy);
219                }
220        }
221        
222        void smoothGradients(float[][][] Dx, float[][][] Dy) {
223                for (int k = 0; k < Dx.length; k++) {
224                        gaussianBlur(Dx[k], params.sigmaG);
225                }
226                for (int k = 0; k < Dy.length; k++) {
227                        gaussianBlur(Dy[k], params.sigmaG);
228                }
229        }
230        
231        void calculateStructureMatrix(float[][][] Dx, float[][][] Dy, float[][][] G) {
232                // compute structure tensor field G
233                // G = new float[width][height][3]; // must be clean for each slice
234                for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
235                        for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
236                                G[0][u][v]= 0.0f;
237                                G[1][u][v]= 0.0f;
238                                G[2][u][v]= 0.0f;
239                                for (int k = 0; k < K; k++) {
240                                        //version 0.2 normalization
241                                        float fx = Dx[k][u][v];
242                                        float fy = Dy[k][u][v];
243                                        G[0][u][v] += fx * fx;
244                                        G[1][u][v] += fx * fy;
245                                        G[2][u][v] += fy * fy;
246                                }
247                        }
248                }
249        }
250        
251        void smoothStructureMatrix(float[][][] G) {
252                for (int i = 0; i < G.length; i++) {
253                        gaussianBlur(G[i], params.sigmaS);
254                }
255        }
256        
257        /*
258         * Compute the local geometry matrix A (used to drive the diffusion process)
259         * from the structure matrix G.
260         */
261        void calculateGeometryMatrix(float[][][] G, float[][][] A) {
262                final double[] lambda12 = new double[2];        // eigenvalues
263                final double[] e1 = new double[2];                      // eigenvectors
264                final double[] e2 = new double[2];
265                final double a1 = params.a1;
266                final double a2 = params.a2;
267                for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
268                        for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
269                                final double G0 = G[0][u][v];   // elements of local geometry matrix (2x2)
270                                final double G1 = G[1][u][v];
271                                final double G2 = G[2][u][v];
272                                // calculate eigenvalues:
273                                if (!realEigenValues2x2(G0, G1, G1, G2, lambda12, e1, e2)) {
274                                        throw new RuntimeException("eigenvalues undefined in " + 
275                                                                TschumperleDericheFilter_OLD.class.getSimpleName());
276                                }
277                                final double val1 = lambda12[0];
278                                final double val2 = lambda12[1];
279                                final double arg = 1.0 + val1 + val2;
280                                final float c1 = (float) Math.pow(arg, -a1);
281                                final float c2 = (float) Math.pow(arg, -a2);
282                                
283                                // calculate eigenvectors:
284                                normalize(e1);
285                                final float ex = (float) e1[0];
286                                final float ey = (float) e1[1];
287                                final float exx = ex * ex;
288                                final float exy = ex * ey;
289                                final float eyy = ey * ey;
290                                A[0][u][v] = c1 * eyy + c2 * exx;
291                                A[1][u][v] = (c2 - c1)* exy;
292                                A[2][u][v] = c1 * exx + c2 * eyy;
293                        }
294                }
295        }
296        
297        // Calculate the Hessian matrix Hk for a single position (u,v) in image Ik.
298        void calculateHessianMatrix(float[][] Ik, int u, int v, float[] Hk) {
299                final int pu = (u > 0) ? u-1 : 0; 
300                final int nu = (u < M-1) ? u+1 : M-1;
301                final int pv = (v > 0) ? v-1 : 0; 
302                final int nv = (v < N-1) ? v+1 : N-1;
303                float icc = Ik[u][v];
304                Hk[0] = Ik[pu][v] + Ik[nu][v] - 2 * icc;                                                                // = H_xx(u,v)
305                Hk[1] = 0.25f * (Ik[pu][pv] + Ik[nu][nv] - Ik[pu][nv] - Ik[nu][pv]);    // = H_xy(u,v)
306                Hk[2] = Ik[u][nv] + Ik[u][pv] - 2 * icc;                                                                // = H_yy(u,v)
307        }
308        
309        /*
310         * Calculate the local image velocity B(k,u,v) from the geometry matrix A(i,u,v)
311         * and the Hessian matrix Hkuv.
312         */
313        float calculateVelocities(float[][][] I, float[][][] A, float[][][] B) {
314                float maxV = Float.MIN_VALUE;
315                float minV = Float.MAX_VALUE;
316                final float[] Hkuv = new float[3];
317                for (int k = 0; k < K; k++) {
318                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
319                                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
320                                        calculateHessianMatrix(I[k], u, v, Hkuv);
321                                        final float a = A[0][u][v];
322                                        final float b = A[1][u][v];
323                                        final float c = A[2][u][v];                                     
324                                        final float ixx = Hkuv[0]; 
325                                        final float ixy = Hkuv[1]; 
326                                        final float iyy = Hkuv[2];
327                                        final float vel = a * ixx + 2 * b * ixy + c * iyy; 
328                                        // find min/max velocity for time-step adaptation
329                                        if (vel > maxV) maxV = vel;
330                                        if (vel < minV) minV = vel;
331                                        B[k][u][v] = vel;
332                                }
333                        }
334                }
335                return Math.max(Math.abs(maxV), Math.abs(minV));
336        }
337
338        // Calculate the Hessian matrix Hk for the whole (single-channel) image Ik.
339//      void calculateHessianMatrix(float[][] Ik, float[][][] Hk) {
340//              for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
341//                      final int pu = (u > 0) ? u-1 : 0; 
342//                      final int nu = (u < M-1) ? u+1 : M-1;
343//                      for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
344//                              final int pv = (v > 0) ? v-1 : 0; 
345//                              final int nv = (v < N-1) ? v+1 : N-1;
346//                              float icc = Ik[u][v];
347//                              Hk[0][u][v] = Ik[pu][v] + Ik[nu][v] - 2 * icc;                                                          // = H_xx(u,v)
348//                              Hk[1][u][v] = 0.25f * (Ik[pu][pv] + Ik[nu][nv] - Ik[pu][nv] - Ik[nu][pv]);      // = H_xy(u,v)
349//                              Hk[2][u][v] = Ik[u][nv] + Ik[u][pv] - 2 * icc;                                                          // = H_yy(u,v)
350//                      }
351//              }
352//      }
353        
354//      float calculateVelocity(float[][][] I, float[][][] A, float[][][] B) {
355//              float maxV = Float.MIN_VALUE;
356//              float minV = Float.MAX_VALUE;
357//              for (int k = 0; k < K; k++) {
358//                      // calculate the Hessian matrix for channel k:
359//                      calculateHessianMatrix(I[k], Hk);
360//                      for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
361//                              for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
362//                                      float a = A[0][u][v];
363//                                      float b = A[1][u][v];
364//                                      float c = A[2][u][v];                                   
365//                                      float ixx = Hk[0][u][v]; 
366//                                      float ixy = Hk[1][u][v]; 
367//                                      float iyy = Hk[2][u][v];
368//                                      float vel = a * ixx + 2 * b * ixy + c * iyy; 
369//                                      // find min/max velocity for time-step adaptation
370//                                      if (vel > maxV) maxV = vel;
371//                                      if (vel < minV) minV = vel;
372//                                      B[k][u][v] = vel;
373//                              }
374//                      }
375//              }
376//              return Math.max(Math.abs(maxV), Math.abs(minV));
377//      }
378        
379        void updateImage(float[][][] I, float[][][] B, double alpha) {
380                final float alphaF = (float) alpha;
381                for (int k = 0; k < K; k++) {
382                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
383                                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
384                                        float inew = I[k][u][v] + alphaF * B[k][u][v];
385                                        // clamp image to the original range (brute!)
386                                        if (inew < initial_min) inew = initial_min;
387                                        if (inew > initial_max) inew = initial_max;
388                                        I[k][u][v] = inew;
389                                }
390                        }
391                }
392        }
393        
394        void copyResultToImage(ImageProcessor ip) {
395                final int[] pixel = new int[K];
396                if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor) {
397                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
398                                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
399                                        for (int k = 0; k < K; k++) {
400                                                int c = params.useLinearRgb ? 
401                                                                Math.round(rgbToSrgb(I[k][u][v])) : 
402                                                                Math.round(I[k][u][v]);
403                                                if (c < 0) c = 0;
404                                                if (c > 255) c = 255;
405                                                pixel[k] = c;
406                                        }
407                                        ip.putPixel(u,v,pixel);
408                                }
409                        }
410                }
411                else {  // 8-bit, 16-bit or 32-bit (float) processor
412                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
413                                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
414                                        ip.setf(u, v, I[0][u][v]);
415                                }
416                        }
417                }
418        }
419        
420        // Utility methods -------------------------------------------------
421        
422        /*
423         * Blur the 2D array source with a Gaussian kernel of width sigma
424         * and store the result in target.
425         */
426        void gaussianBlur(float[][] source, float[][] target, double sigma) {
427                if (sigma < 0.1) return;
428                if (source.length != target.length || source[0].length != target[0].length) {
429                        throw new Error("source/target arrays have different dimensions");
430                }
431                float[][] Hgx = makeGaussKernel1D(sigma, true);         // horizontal 1D kernel
432                float[][] Hgy = makeGaussKernel1D(sigma, false);        // vertical 1D kernel
433                convolve2dArray(source, target, Hgx, Hgy);
434        }
435        
436        void gaussianBlur(float[][] source, double sigma) {     // source = target
437                gaussianBlur(source, source, sigma);
438        }
439        
440        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
441        
442        /*
443         * Convolve the 2D array source successively with a sequence of kernels
444         * and store the result in target.
445         * TODO: This should be implemented without an ImageJ FloatProcessor!
446         * TODO: Use methods from imagingbook/lib/filters/GaussianFilter ! 
447         */
448        void convolve2dArray(float[][] source, float[][] target, float[][]... kernels) {
449                if (source.length != target.length || source[0].length != target[0].length) {
450                        throw new Error("source/target arrays have different dimensions");
451                }
452                int w = source.length;
453                int h = source[0].length;
454                if (tmpFp == null || tmpFp.getWidth() != w || tmpFp.getHeight() != h) {
455                        tmpFp = new FloatProcessor(w, h);
456                }
457                // copy data to FloatProcessors         
458                for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
459                        for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
460                                tmpFp.setf(u, v, source[u][v]);
461                        }
462                }
463                
464                Convolver conv = new Convolver();
465                conv.setNormalize(false);
466                // convolve with all specified kernels
467                for (float[][] H : kernels) {
468                        if (H == null) break;
469                        int wH = H.length;
470                        int hH = H[0].length;
471                        float[] H1 = flatten(H);
472                        conv.convolveFloat(tmpFp, H1, wH, hH);
473                }
474                // copy data back to array      
475                for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
476                        for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
477                                target[u][v] = tmpFp.getf(u, v);
478                        }
479                }
480        }
481        
482        /*
483         * Copy a 2D float  array into a 1D float array
484         */
485        float[] flatten (float[][] arr2d) {
486                int w = arr2d.length;
487                int h = arr2d[0].length;
488                float[] arr1d = new float[w*h];
489                int k = 0;
490                for (int i = 0; i < w; i++) {
491                        for (int j = 0; j < h; j++) {
492                                arr1d[k] = arr2d[i][j];
493                                k++;
494                        }
495                }
496                return arr1d;
497        }
498        
499        /*
500         * Construct a 2D Gaussian filter kernel large enough to avoid truncation effects.
501         * Returns a 1D kernel as a 2D array, so it can be used flexibly in horizontal
502         * or vertical direction.
503         */
504        private float[][] makeGaussKernel1D(double sigma, boolean horizontal){
505                // Construct a 2D Gaussian filter kernel large enough
506                // to avoid truncation effects.
507                final double sigma2 = sigma * sigma;
508                final double scale = 1.0 / (Math.sqrt(2 * Math.PI) * sigma);    
509                final int rad = Math.max((int) (3.5 * sigma), 1); 
510                int size = rad + 1 +rad;        //center cell = kernel[rad]
511                float[][] kernel = (horizontal) ?  
512                                new float[size][1] : 
513                                new float[1][size]; 
514                double sum = 0;
515                for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
516                        double x = rad - i;
517                        float val = (float) (scale * Math.exp(-0.5 * (x*x) / sigma2));
518                        if (horizontal) 
519                                kernel[i][0] =  val;
520                        else 
521                                kernel[0][i] =  val;
522                        sum = sum + val;
523                }
524                
525                // normalize (just to be safe)
526                for (int i = 0; i < kernel.length; i++) {
527                        for (int j = 0; j < kernel[i].length; j++) {
528                                kernel[i][j] = (float) (kernel[i][j] / sum);
529                        }
530                }
531                return kernel;
532        }
533        
534        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
535        
536        void normalize(double[] vec) {
537                double sum = 0;
538                for (double v : vec) {
539                        sum = sum + v * v;
540                }
541                if (sum > 0.000001) {
542                        double s = 1 / Math.sqrt(sum);
543                        for (int i = 0; i < vec.length; i++) {
544                                vec[i] = vec[i] * s;
545                        }
546                }
547        }
548        
549        boolean realEigenValues2x2 (
550                        double A, double B, double C, double D, 
551                        double[] lam12, double[] x1, double[] x2) {
552                final double R = (A + D) / 2;
553                final double S = (A - D) / 2;
554                final double V = S * S + B * C;
555                if (V < 0) 
556                        return false; // matrix has no real eigenvalues
557                else {
558                        double T = Math.sqrt(V);
559                        lam12[0] = R + T;       // lambda_1
560                        lam12[1] = R - T;       // lambda_2
561                        if ((A - D) >= 0) {
562                                x1[0] = S + T;  //e_1x
563                                x1[1] = C;              //e_1y                  
564                                x2[0] = B;              //e_2x
565                                x2[1] = -S - T; //e_2y          
566                        } 
567                        else {
568                                x1[0] = B;              //e_1x
569                                x1[1] = -S + T; //e_1y  
570                                x2[0] = S - T;  //e_2x
571                                x2[1] = C;              //e_2y  
572                        }
573                        return true;
574                }
575        }
576        
577        //  RGB/sRGB conversion -----------------------------------
578        // TODO: move this to lib.colorimage.sRgbUtil class
579        
580        float srgbToRgb(float nc) {
581                float nc01 = nc/255;
582                return (float)(gammaInv(nc01) * 255);
583        }
584
585        float rgbToSrgb(float lc) {
586                float lc01 = lc/255;
587                return (float) (gammaFwd(lc01) * 255);
588        }
589        
590        
591        double gammaFwd(double lc) {    // input: linear component value
592                return (lc > 0.0031308) ?
593                        (1.055 * Math.pow(lc, 1/2.4) - 0.055) :
594                        (lc * 12.92);
595    }
596    
597    double gammaInv(double nc) {        // input: nonlinear component value
598        return (nc > 0.03928) ?
599                        Math.pow((nc + 0.055)/1.055, 2.4) :
600                        (nc / 12.92);
601    }
602
603}
604
